WRITING.TEXT: Some shitty show just came on my TV called "The Goldbergs", that seems to be set in the 80s.

Just may as well not have it in place to begin with.

The first is a lie. You are using Americanisms throughout, and that has nothing to do with autocorrect and the phone would have a UK Dictionary in it. Mine was purchased in Sweden, still has English (UK) as a dictionary. You have to remember that just about every country uses British English in their learning (apart from the US, of course). So, British English should be the default English keyboard on most devices purchased outside of the US.
Good luck lying when you are in marketing. That is, without a doubt, the worst profession to lie in.

Why is it the 'least desirable and least respectable profession in the modern era'. Is this because of what a certain somebody has told you?
And no, the editor would not be told what he/she can publish. The PR company for the person that we are about to report on my say "if you report on this, we will never work with you again", which is not the government trying to stifle anything. This is something which occurs in every country in the world. The editor will then need to way up whether they can make more money publishing or make more money working with the PR company. This has happened a LOT. Gay footballers, for instance. Journalists know who the gay footballers are, but they will not release the names because the PR companies will threaten with not working with them again. This means cutting off a massive source of revenue. Again, something that happens in other countries.
But hey, you are insulting my profession and not 100% sure why. Sum your arguments, because it certainly is not least-desirable as more people than ever are getting into journalism.

I am British.
If I reported on paedophilia (why are you using American spellings when you are British?), I would not be told to 'shut up' by the government. If anyone were to tell me to shut up, it would be my editor. If I had evidence, I could report on whatever the hell I wanted.
Don't tell me I don't know what I am talking about ;)

You *can't* say something which threatens violence against another group.
You can say:

You can't say:
"Go and kill all Muslims"
